See also: gleis and gléis

German[edit]

Alternative forms[edit]

  • Geleise (Switzerland, Austria)

Etymology[edit]

The contemporary form is shortened from the variant Geleise, from Middle High German geleis (“track”), itself pertaining to Middle High German leise, from Old High German leisa.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ɡlaɪ̯s/
  • Audio (Austria)
    		(file)
  • Audio
    		(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɪ̯s

Noun[edit]

Gleis n (genitive Gleises, plural Gleise)

  1. railway (track on which trains run)
  2. (individual) track

Usage notes[edit]

  • In German train stations, trains are announced as leaving from a numbered track, not a platform. Platforms (Bahnsteige) give access to one or two tracks, and are usually not numbered themselves.
